page.title: 03Agriculture
page.content: The farming in the area is mixed. The farmland is mainly given over to temporary pasture as well as for fodder crops. The fodder here is a new root crop derived from crossing rape with turnip, and is grown on many farms throughout the area, including {Hipley Barn Farm}in the north. As well as pasture,{Carman's Farm}in the west has maize and{Ashlands Farm}in the north grows potatoes. The livestock consists of both dairy and beef cattle. Hipley Barn Farm in the north has l5O dairy cows, which are milked twice a day. A mill is situated near Carman's Farm in Boarhunt, alongside the Wallington river.
